forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 49. North northwest wind 6 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. North wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks into the evening hours, Downtown San Francisco lies under a canopy of partly cloudy skies. The temperature settles comfortably around 49, a gentle chill that calls for a light jacket or a warm sweater, perfect for an evening stroll along the waterfront. A north-northwest breeze dances through the streets, teasing the edges of your clothing with brisk gusts reaching up to 25 miles per hour. The cityscape, barely illuminated by the fading remnants of daylight, carries a certain calmness that invites reflection.

Tomorrow promises a sun-drenched reprieve with a high hovering near 64, although the air will cool as afternoon drifts in, embracing a subtle shift to around 61. The forecast hints at clear skies, with a fresh north wind continuing to invigorate the atmosphere, ensuring clarity in view and spirit alike. For those planning their day, a leisurely walk across the Golden Gate Bridge or a quiet coffee at a quaint café in the Mission District could be delightful ways to savor the sun and brisk air, when the city fully awakens and vibrates with life. These conditions are ripe for indulging in the simple pleasures the city offers—perhaps even a casual read in a park or a leisurely visit to one of its many art galleries, where the serene warmth of the sun can complement the artistic experience.
